Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: TERTIUS G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ida hotel is certainly situated perfectly for general sightseeing - but that's about all it has to offer on the plus side. Rooms are very small, ranging from bad to worse if you have the basement room. It gets very noisy at night from returning guests and the hotel reception. Do NOT let the hotel book any activities such as the fish restaurant dinner or Turkish baths. We were massively overcharged for the dinner - Â£90 for a plate of meze, 3 prawns and a seabass! No bellydancing, no tasteful meal and no other patrons as promised by the hotel. Breakfast consists of old bread, instant coffee, tomatoes, 3 mini slices of polony, dried olives and cherry jam. The portions became progressively smaller every morning to the point of spartan proportions. Wifi in the hotel is incredibly slow if you are fortunate to be logged on for longer than 2 minutes. All in all, Ida hotel was a little disappointing in every aspect and the staff may be helpful, but they are completely clueless as to pricing of anything on offer. There are much better, cleaner and better equipped hotels all around Ida hotel - avoid unless you have no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Michal M
Reviews.Content: Really good value for money proposal. The cheapest in the heart of Istanbul in Sultanahmet district. Really close to the best what Istanbul can you offer. It's budget proposal so do not expect anything special but it was clean and nothing unexpected happened to us. In addition, you have a breakfast served at the top of the building in order to admire the picturesque scenery of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Do you want a cheap place to stay in Istanbul? Here you are”
Reviews.Author: foffissimo
Reviews.Content: Really a surprise this Ida hotel. It's near to all fundamental monuments in Istanbul, but it's also a cheap hotel, suited for young couples or friends.It's clean, confortable. You can sleep quite good at night.Bathroom is quite big, hot water is always there. If you are looking for a good place to spend your holidays in Istanbul, try to llok at it first.

Reviews.Title: “Great when travelling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jerome b
Reviews.Content: Location of Ida hotel is key: Akbiyik cad. in the middle of Sultanahmet and close to all main monuments, also very well deserved by public transports. Staff were very nice and helpful, breakfast was good also, served on the outside terrace offering an astonishing view on Istanbul and the sea of Marmara. Rooms are small but cosy enough and allow for good sleeps at night even though we were sleeping on the street side. The point at issue for us was the cleanliness although we are not fussy, the floor was really dirty and was not washed a single time during the 7 days we stayed there, the room was always very dusty. Most towels were stained when we arrived even though they seemed cleaned afterwards and the bathroom sink needed attention also. The water in the shower did not evacuate normally. Even on a budget you would expect higher standards. The beautiful terrace view also was quite spoilt by the uncleanliness of it. We would recommend this hotel for those like us who would travel on a budget since Istanbul has so much to offer. However for very little extra (â‚¬10/night/room) you could afford other hotels in Sultanhamet located in quieter streets. No matter what hotel you choose however, YOU MUST GO TO ISTANBUL !!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Roresand
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ida is located at exactly the right spot in Istanbul--in Sultanahmet next door to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc. In district that is chock full of restaurants, souvenir and rug vendors. While it is all about tourists in this neighborhood, the hotels and shops are small so it still feels pretty low-key. The two men and one woman working at the hotel that I met were the best ever--considerate, one even serving as a volunteer (unpaid) guide one morning. The breakfasts were the best; the basic olives, tomatoes, cucumbers, cold cuts, boiled egg, crusty bread PLUS a thin eggy crepe or a kind of crispy french toast.There are a couple of issues which one might expect for the very reasonable prices. One is to get to the lovely breakfasts on the balcony you must climb three very steep and crampled little flights of stairs, although I am sure if you could not do that one of the kind staff would bring you breakfast. The other--no lamps in the room, just the glare of an overhead bulb. Everything considered though--they are small problems.

Reviews.Title: “Best value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minnnara
Reviews.Content: I must say that the location of this hotel is superb! Everything is very near and walking distance.The staff is friendly and Its clean. My room is a bit chilly due to the warmer is not working well, but, it is still ok.The breakfast for the first day was great, but, after that, it was not so good. Generally, I love this hotel, great value and strategic location.Gonna be here again for my next trip, for sure

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ellek79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ida hotel, it was the best hotel we have ever stayed at the staff were so quick to help make our stay amazing in fact were planning a trip back. the only thing I did not like was the stairs for breakfast but the veiw was worth every step. and two days the staff brought my breakfast to my room

Reviews.Title: “Average B&B in Istabnul”
Reviews.Author: boris_texnic
Reviews.Content: Ida is located in the heart of Sultanahmet among a lot of others. You can easily find it on the street if you take the right one from the Blue Mosque. They offer good prices in case of long stay, credit cards are accepted. But we chose it because of view ofer Marmara sea from the terrace, and I`m not sure it was a right choice. Our room was very small and located on basement level. It has no windows! From there to terrace we had to pass 4 levels up by steepy stairs. They served breakfast on this terrace, but only bread, olives and tea! Actually I can`t say that was a breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: llisah
Reviews.Content: I would agree, this is more of a hostel than hotel. Travelling with my daughter who likes to rough it a bit, it was just a double bed in a small room. Didn't seem very clean but it was alright for the price. Perfect location. Istanbul is a great city. We loved this city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and comfortable budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sailorlass
Reviews.Content: Really close to the major historical buildings, less than10 minutes walk and that was in the heat! Clean, comfortable, good shower, view out over street and an area on the roof to collapse at night for a drink. The room was small but we only slept there. Staff were kind and helpful. Brought us a cup of tea our first night there and then showed us where we could make our own. Substantial breakfast up on the roof with views where you could watch the shipping and in the other direction see the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. Great place to stay, if watching the pennies, but you need to be able to handle stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: joisEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Small, friendly hotel in a perfect location. Staff very helpful. 5 min walk to historical attractions and easy access to the tram system. Plenty of restaurants and bars on this street to enjoy. Only issue is steep staircase to breakfast terrace, not suitabile to anyone with a disability. Would certainly return to this hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: rp1709
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ida is a small hotel on a lively road full of hostels and hotels for a range of ages. I was travelling with a friend, and found the location of Ida was ideal for restaurants and shisha, which is what we were looking for as we did not want to travel long distances to eat at night. The blue mosque is just a five minute walk away as is the nearest tram stop, which connects Sultanahmet to the rest of Istanbul. The area is full of tourists and seems safe - we had no problems when we were there. As for the hotel itself the rooms are on the small side but there is a good sized double bed with sufficient space for luggage. We were given the basement room - not ideal but since we didn't spend much time in the room itself it didn't really bother us. The breakfast is served on the small roof terrace four floors up (with a view of the blue mosque on one side and the sea on the other side). One thing which concerned us was the stairs in the hotel are steep, narrow and made of marble so if you're not careful you could easily fall! Breakfast consists of rolls or bread, three slices of cucumber and tomato and some sort of pink meat - not a great meal but after speaking to other tourists living in similar budget hotels is apparently common in Turkey. We were looking for a budget hotel in Istanbul with a good location and good transport links - and this hotel satisfies that. However if you want to relax in your hotel room on holiday, I wouldn't recommend Ida - try the Four Seasons nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, good views, so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: v_and_m_f
Reviews.Content: Note: I know I don't have many reviews up yet, but I'm totally a real person! This was our first big trip, and thanks TA for all the reccs, and I'm working my way through my own reviews of all the places we stayed in Turkey and Greece. We chose this hotel based on TA reviews -- looking for something well-located, clean, affordable, and with good views. We were satisfied, and it was a pleasant stay, but if we went back to Istanbul, we'd probably try another hotel to see what else is out there. The best thing about it was the rooftop area. The other reviews are right; Blue Mosque to one side and Sea of Marmaris to the other. From our rooms (we requested the best view and had it for the first two nights, but they had informed us we'd need to move one floor down the third night due to another reservation), we could also see the minarets of the Blue Mosque. It was also a very convenient location, although we were there during the World Cup and could hear the busy restaurants and bars on the street below us at night (but we slept fine). The rooms were TINY -- space for the bed and that's about it, and the one on the top floor had a huge waterstain in the ceiling, plus the bathroom wasn't spotless. The room below it, that we moved to on our last night, was actually a little nicer. I don't remember them coming to clean it while we were there. But it was comfortable enough, and the shower was decent - showerhead like we're used to, walled in like we're used to, decent water pressure and hot water. This is NOT a hotel for anyone who has trouble with stairs. I suppose you could stay on the first floor, but to get up to the other rooms and the roof, you take the crazy tiny windy staircase. Didn't bother us, but just an FYI. Overall a good stay, and Istanbul itself was AMAZING. The man (owner?) was very pleasant and his (wife?) who served breakfast every morning was also nice. The (son?) who also worked the front desk was ok, except for the fact that when we arrived later than we thought we would, due to a delayed flight, the first thing he said to us when we walked in was an accusing, "Why are you so late?" It was pretty rude, but didn't really bother us -- it was mostly just weird and confusing. (This may have had to do with the fact that we got the shuttle service through the hotel which worked out great but I feel bad if that poor driver was waiting the whole couple extra hours for us at the airport since we'd had no way to call ahead once delayed. Also a word to the wise -- we saw tons of travel agencies around, advertising airport to hotel service, for about a third of the cost.) PS - passing on the best advice we received: Get to the major stuff (Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia, etc) EARLY in the morning -- it's SO worth it to beat the crowds. We thought the extra ticket price for the harem at the palace was worth it. And don't miss Basilica Cistern. So cool!

Reviews.Title: “A very good budget option”
Reviews.Author: Bluebirdfan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ida is a good basic no frills budget hotel in the located in the Sultanahmet area in the centre of historical Istanbul. It is only 5 minutes walk to the main historical monuments of Istanbul including, The Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Saint Sophia, Basilica Cistern. It is only a cheap no frills basic hotel but we spent very little time in the room (we only slept in the room). We had one of the basement rooms at the back on it was quite quiet. The bathroom was clean with hot water for showers and breakfast is served on the room terrace with views over the Bosphorus. There are only about 8 rooms and it looks like the rooms have been refurbished in the last few years. One apparent downside is that room keys seem to open all rooms not just your own as my wife found out when she managed to open someone elses door by mistake. If we went back to Istanbul we would be happy to stay again at the Hotel Ida

Reviews.Title: “great price and people”
Reviews.Author: globe11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IDA Hotel in early and late April 2010 for a total of 7 days, the location can't be beat as you are in the Old City, very close to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia, Cistern, most of the other "must see" sites. IT is a 15-20 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice market but not that further. The Ida has many nice restaurants nearby but the people eating can be a little loud at night. If you stay there be sure to get a room not on the same floor as where the reception is, can be loud. Go for the rooms upstairs. The stairs are a bit steep but many hotels are like that even the 4 star ones. The people though are very friendly and try to make things work out for you. The place was clean. We really liked it. The breakfast was minimal though but it is at the covered rooftop with the seagulls and a view of Sea of Mamara. It is a nice place! We would do it again. Makr your reservations at least 4-6 months in advance as it seemed to be a popular hotel, there were people trying to make reservations for several days but they were quite booked up already.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: darla6368
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul and we stayed at Hotel Ida for 11 days. Being we did not want to be totally lost trying to find our hotel on our own, through the hotel, we arranged for a driver to meet us at the airport and drive us to the hotel. Our friendly and courteous driver was waiting for us holding a sign with my name and hotel. Once we arrived, we found the hotel staff extremely helpful and very nice. Of the 4 friendly people on staff I saw, Shaban and Julia were there every day and helped make our stay extra comfortable, worry free and enjoyable! The hotel and room was small, but very clean and neat adding to a cozy atmosphere. The room was cleaned and the linens were changed daily. There is satellite TV and air conditioning, but we did not use either. We did however, use the free internet service. There was a daily breakfast consisting of a hard boiled egg, some kind of cold meat, rolls, cheese, jam, butter, bread, tomato, olives and coffee, tea or juice. It was served on the roof patio where you can see the Blue Mosque and the sea. The hotel is conveniently located to many resturants and shops just outside on either side of the street and is a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and the Hippodrome. If we are in Istanbul again, we will try and stay at Hotel Ida again. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: the_spoiled_one
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ida in Sultanamet....Let it be known that I am a very hard person to plaese, but I have absolutely no complaints about Ida. The man and woman who run the place are very friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms (all four of them) are small, but clean and cosy! It is a wonderful location for most of the top sites in Istanbul ( most are within walking distance) or a short tram ride away! Great value for money, I would definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Small dirty room”
Reviews.Author: telislinda
Reviews.Content: First night we got a small room with view over Bosporen that was quiet and not too bad. Then, we were moved to the other side and got a even smaller room (no chair, just a tine low table) that was really dirty. Long black hairs on the floor and although we put all our things off the floor it was never cleaned during our 4 nights stay. The wc was very small too, and even more dirty. Also, sometimes there was not water pressure enough to take shower. Nevertheless, credit to the staff, the breakfast was okay and the roof terrace was nice. And the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice people”
Reviews.Author: sportcoat
Reviews.Content: We stumbled into here after our other hotel overbooked us and we didn't want to stay at the dingy place they had reserved for us instead. The guy at reception was super nice, they had a room, at 45E it was a great value. Super clean, cozy, great location for the sights, and free wifi. It was all we needed for a night. Had to leave early, so can't attest to the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: nmarci99
Reviews.Content: We were two times in this hotel in August, first for 3 nights and 3 weeks later for 1 night. Each time we slept in the basement room, and we really didn't need the AC. The breakfast was always boiled egg, cheese, jam, butter, bread, tomato, olive, melon and coffe or tea, and it was served on the roof terasse, from where you can see the blue mosque and the sea. The receptionist is a good guy, he always helps you, if he can. The hotel is very close to the main attractions (Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Hippodrome) and not to far from the Sirkeci train station (20 min. walk). There are a lot of restaurants (but there are a bit expensive) and other hotels on the street of the Ida. I think that next time we will go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: Laperle
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was new and clean. The combo of price, location, room, free BF makes it the best deal in the area! The bed linens were changed daily, which was sooo nice! We truly were satisfied with the hospitality we have received. Thanks to Recep, Shawan and Julia!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: easymover
Reviews.Content: great location, very clean rooms, staff extremely helpful and friendly, Shaban at reception was great, picking us up from the tram the first morning he has plenty of info and suggestions,would return and definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Ida Hotel: the place for your holiday”
Reviews.Author: dagemilano
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a strategic position in the city and you can reach any place by foot. Rooms are perfect for couples and/or friends and breakfast is kindly served on a little terrace from where you can see the beautiful Blue Mosque. Staff is sooo friendly and you will definally feel at home!!

Reviews.Title: “Best budget option in the heart of Sultanahment”
Reviews.Author: GeRuiXin
Reviews.Content: Ida hotel is a great budget choice right in the middle of things. The rooms and bathrooms are clean, and breakfast can be enjoyed in the terrace (great view). The highlight of the hotel is the receptionist, Shawan, who was extremely friendly and helpful during our stay. We stayed there for 4 nights and everything was great apart from not being able to use the air con one night because apparently it was noisy in another room and the guests complained. All in all, definitely great value for money and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good home base when you are out to explore”
Reviews.Author: kapooosha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ida hotel in early April. We made a booking last minute through booking.com and were surprised when we received an email from the hotel staff asking whether we needed to be picked up at the airport. We did and that went very smoothly. The staff at the hotel were super nice to us throughout our stay. In fact, we felt like we were staying with some distant relatives that we've met for the first time - the atmosphere was friendly and informal. The room was clean, quite small, and there was a lot of noise coming from the street at night and from a construction site nearby in the morning. However, I think that it's just a part of staying in Sultanahmet - it's going to be noisy. The breakfast was minimal, but fresh (3 types of cheese, veggies, olives, fresh bread and tea). The location of the hotel was perfect, we walked to many historical sites, and there were plenty of dining options. In other words, it's a great home base when you are exploring all day and are not at the hotel too much.

Reviews.Title: “A stay to remember”
Reviews.Author: bowlalong
Reviews.Content: This was booked for us by a Turkish friend. He did not let us down. The staff were very attentive and helpful. The owner was very friendly. Breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace (in glorious sunshine), where one would eat in bad weather i know not. The price for the three of us for three nights was 320 Turkish lira. The triple room was small but adequate. An added bonus was that all the main attractions were within walking distance. I would stay there again ,next time for a week hopefully

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ida
HotelInfo.Address: Cankurtaran Mah. Akbiyik Caddesi No 31 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
